title: As Omicron Variant Spreads, States Aim for Balance Between Curbs and Safety
sub_head: Governments seek to avoid the strict measures of previous Covid-19 surges, with more vaccinations and rapid tests and by tracking hospitalizations
body:
As states grapple with how to rein in the spread of the Omicron variant, many governors and other state officials are applying a lighter touch than during previous surges, as they are armed with more tools to combat the virus and increasingly mindful of the economic harm caused by sweeping restrictions.
Many decision makers say they are trying to avoid strict measures enacted during previous Covid surges by encouraging vaccinations, increasing capacity for rapid testing and closely watching factors such as hospital admissions and booster-shot uptake.
